intro: Uragoga barcellana, commonly known as the Barcellanese uragoga, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring, typically in shades of pale purple and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
